author: eTN Global Editor
title: Barbados Food & Wine and Rum - shaken not stirred
text:
Barbados Food & Wine and Rum - shaken not stirred   
Sep 03, 2015 eTN   
BRIDGETOWN, Barbados – Endless culinary delights, rum, polo, shopping, beach fun and late night parties await the attendees of the revamped Barbados Food & Wine and Rum Festival 2015. 
“We felt that in our sixth year we would shake things up a bit and incorporate more of our other tourism product offerings into this highly successful festival”, said CEO of the Barbados Tourism Marketing Inc. (BTMI), William Griffith during the Barbados launch event at the Fairmont Royal Pavilion Hotel. 
Among this year’s headliners are Carla Hall, co-host on ABC Daytime’s lifestyle series, The Chew in the USA; Cliff Harding, executive chef at Toronto’s upscale Sutton Place Hotel; Andrew Pern, whose name is synonymous with the Michelin-starred Starr Inn in Harome in the North of England; and Chris Cosentino, an American author and celebrity chef of Food Network and Top Chef Master’s fame. 
They will be joined by perennial favorite, chef Marcus Samuelsson. This Ethiopia-born, Harlem-dweller who has fallen in love with Barbados, will also host a special ‘Bajan Invasion’ launch party in his famous Red Rooster restaurant on Sept. 17. 
Griffith revealed that the BTMI’s teams were implementing an extensive global marketing strategy that will include additional launch events in the UK, Canada and Trinidad; discounted travel deals; digital advertising; media relations; and a new, engaging website at foodwinerum.com.
